items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

The Environment Agency Flood Warning System has issued this message based on rising river or tidal levels.
We are temporarily automating our messages due to industrial action.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold but may rise again before Christmas morning.    Further rainfall is forecast over the next few days.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
The situation is improving and no further flooding is expected in this area. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Further rainfall shower is forecast tomorrow 25/12/2022.
We continue to monitor the situation. Our incident response staff are checking structures and our river monitoring equipment.

items.message:
River levels have peaked at Horley and Kinnersley Manor and are now falling. The risk of flooding has now passed at this time. 
The weather forecast is for a predominantly dry day throughout today, Saturday 24/12/2022 with the next rainfall forecast for Sunday 25/12/22. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further flood alerts if necessary.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
Flooding is expected in this area. This means properties are at risk of flooding.
Please take action to protect yourself and your property and monitor local weather and river conditions. Avoid contact with, walking or driving through flood water. Consider activating any property flood protection products you may have.

The Environment Agency Flood Warning System has issued this message based on rising river or tidal levels.
We are temporarily automating our messages due to industrial action.
